msContents.summary: Tax register, recording day by day the collection of money taxes.

msItemStruct.note: Pub. status: Recto; Verso is blank
+ P.Cair. Inv. 57187; P.Iand. VII, 141; P.Mich. Inv. 2830; 3159; 4910

condition.ab: Regularly cut at the right hand side. Kollesis at the left hand side of col. 109. There are some lacunae and damage in the beginning of the column at the result of vertical fold. The lower part is irregularly cut. Although there are some damages and a big lacuna in the left handside of the coumn, the taxt is almost complete. No restoration is needed. (MA)

handDesc.p: Written in a quick but clear cursive. The scribe separated a new entry from the preceding one by mark an oblique stroke going downwards to the left edge in the upper part, or underlining the name of the taxpayer . (MA)

origin.origPlace: Karanis, Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt
origin.persName: Karanos, son of Orsenouphis, grandson of Imouthes, mother Tapetsiris (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 180)
Limnaios, son of Onnophris, grandson of Satabous, mother Ptolema (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 185)
Mysthes the younger, son of Dioskoros, grandson of Mysthes, mother Tepheros (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 188)
Ptolemaios, son of Ptolemaios, grandson of Horos, mother Eserempis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 219)
Ptolemais, daughter of Apollonios (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 220)
Ischyras, chief of police (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 179)
Paoueites, son of Petheus, grandson of Phasis, mother Tapetheus (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 197)
Ptolemaios, son of Petheus, grandson of Heras, mother Thaisas (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 219)
Petheus, son of Onnophris (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 202)
Petenas (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 210)
Akousarion, son of Euhemeros (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 150)
Tapetheus, daughter of Euhemeros (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 236)
Chairemon, son of Horos, grandson of Onnophris, mother Segathis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 247)
Petaus, son of Petheus, grandson of Petaus, mother Tapasion (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 209)
Aphrodisios, son of Anchophis, grandson of Petheus, mother Melanous (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 157)
Phanomgeus, son of Petheus, grandson of Satabous, mother Tamystha (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 245)
Heron, son of Horos, grandson of Petheus, mother Taharpagathes (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 171)
Panesneus, son of Ischyras, grandson of Petheus, mother Thaesis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 197)
Sarapion, son of Ptolemaios, grandson of Sarapion, mother Thaesis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 225)
Petheus, son of Kanis, grandson of Petheus, mother Tkollainis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 202)
Petheus, son of Kanis, cultivator in the 70th cleruchy (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 202)
Lucius Antonius Pomp()anus (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 185)
Marinus, son of Kelaulis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 186)
Marcus Sempronius Clemens (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 186)
Marinus (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 186)

provenance.p: Karanis, Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

div.ab: �ǣ(Column). 110;Petheus alias Karanos, son of Sokmenis, grandson of Sokmenis, mother Tasokmenis, 40 drachmas;;Sempronios Herminos through Sarapias (Patkilke);;orchard taxes for the 12th year apomoira 8 drachmas, 2.5 obols, tax on the produce of olive oil 1 drachma, 0.5 obol, naubion 4.5 obols, surcharges 2drachmas, 0.5 obol;;{in the left margin: 56 drachmas, 21 obols of which my deposit 40 drachmas} eparourion 5 drachmas, surcharges 2,5 obols, kollybos 2 obols, the total 18 drachmas, 0.5 obol;;{in the left margin: the remaining 16 drachmas, 21 obols} geometria for the 12th year 37 drachmas, 3 obols, surcharges 2 drachmas, 2 obols, 2 chalkoi, the total 39 drachmas, 5 obols, 2 chalkoi;;Aphrodisis, son of Ptolemaios (son of Ptollas the steward);;{in the left margin: 104 drachmas} orchard taxes for the 12th year, apomoira 20 drachmas, tax on the produce of olive oil 2 drachmas, 5 obols, naubion 2 drachmas, surcharges 5 drachmas;;eparourion 14 drachmas, 1 obol, surcharges 1 drachmas, 1.5 obols, 2 chalkoi, kollybos 4.5 obols, 2 chalkoi, the total 45 drachmas, 5.5 obols;;geometria for the 12th year 50 drachmas, surcharges 3 drachmas, 0.5 obol, 2 chalkoi, the total 53 drachmas, 0.5 obol, 2 chalkoi;;naubion of the katoikoi for 13th year 3 drachmas, 2 obols, surcharges 2 obols, kollybos 0.5 obol;;Gaios Julius Isidoros (son of Maronas);;{in the left margin: 4 drachmas, 23 obols, the remaining 10 obols} orchard taxes for the 12th year apomoira 1 drachma, 1.5 obols, tax on the produce of olive oil, 1 obol, 2 chalkoi, naubion 0.5 obol, 2 chalkoi, surcharges 2 chalkoi;;eparourion 5 obols, surcharges 0.5 obols, kollybos 0.5 obol, the total 2 drachmas, 5.5 obols;;geometria for the 12th year 3 drachmas, 0.5 obol, 2 chalkoi, surcharges 1 obol, 2 chalkoi, the total 3 drachmas, 2 obols;;the total for the day 432 drachmas, 16 obols;;the 17th of the same (month);;Maron, son of Satabous, grandson of Maron, mother Tkonnos, the administrator fee 4 drachmas;;Menches the brother, the same mother, the administrator fee 4 drachmas;;Anchophis, son of Kanis, grandson of Anchophis, mother Thermouthis, the administrator fee 4 drachmas;;Petsiris, son of Pasion, grandson of Petsiris, mother Taonnophris, the administrator fee 4 drachmas;;Achillas, son of Ptollis, grandson of Hieranouphis, mother Thermouthis, the administrator fee 4 drachmas;;Maron, son of Petheus the younger, grandson of Anchorimphis, mother Apollonous, 28 bonze obols;;Petoraipis, son of Hatris, grandson of Imouthes, mother Soeris, 4 (bronze) drachmas 4 drachmas, the remaining the administrator fee;;Mysthes, son of Teberis, grandson of Sambathion, mother Isidora, the administrator fee 8 drachmas;;Herakleides, son of Abykis, grandson of Abykis, mother Herais, the administrator fee 4 drachmas;;Onnophris, son of Menches, grandson of Onnophris, mother Thaseis, 8 bronze drachmas, the remaining the administrator fee;;Harpagathes, son of Satabous, grandson of Anchophis, mother Sambathion, the administrator fee 28 obols;;Onnophris, son of Petheus, grandson of Petheus, mother Ptolema, the administrator fee 8 drachmas;;Harsiesis, son of Petheus, grandson of Harsiesis, mother Thatris, the administrator fee 4 drachmas;;Psenesis, son of Pharmenion, grandson of Psenesis, mother Tkonnos, the administrator fee 4 drachmas;;Heron, son of Onnophris, grandson of Theabennis, mother Tapetheus, the administrator fee 4 drachmas.�ǥ
